title: A novel dual-release scaffold for fluorescent labels improves cyclic immunofluorescence
content:
RSC Chem. Biol., 2024, 5,684-690
DOI: 10.1039/D4CB00007B, Paper
Open Access
Â  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 3.0 Unported Licence.
Thorge Reiber, Christian Dose, Dmytro A. Yushchenko
Cyclic immunofluorescence is a powerful method to generate high-content imaging datasets for investigating cell biology and developing therapies. A dual-release mechanism facilitates fast and efficient cleavage of fluorophores from target antigens.
